sentences.sContent: My personal view is that we shouldn’t offer him the job.
sentences.sCn: 我个人认为我们不该给他这份工作。

sentences.sContent: Style and colour are a matter of personal taste .
sentences.sCn: 款式和颜色是个人爱好问题。

sentences.sContent: She took full personal responsibility for all the arrangements.
sentences.sCn: 她个人对所有的安排承担全部责任。

sentences.sContent: When I went to her room all her personal belongings had gone.
sentences.sCn: 我到她房间时，她所有的私人物品都已不在了。

sentences.sContent: After Alan’s death, his mother received his personal effects .
sentences.sCn: 艾伦死后，他母亲接收了他的私人物品。

sentences.sContent: I know from personal experience that you can’t trust Ralph.
sentences.sCn: 根据我的亲身经验，我认为你不能相信拉尔夫。

sentences.sContent: the personal qualities needed to be successful in business
sentences.sCn: 生意成功所需要的个人素质

sentences.sContent: The car is for personal use only.
sentences.sCn: 这辆汽车仅供私人使用。

sentences.sContent: On a personal level he felt sympathy for them, but he had a job to do.
sentences.sCn: 从个人角度他很同情他们，但是他有任务在身。

sentences.sContent: celebrities with their own personal trainer
sentences.sCn: 拥有私人健身教练的名流

phrases.pCn: 个人信息，个人情况；个人资料，个人资讯
个人发展；人的能力发展
个人护理；个人护理用品
个人利益；个人兴趣爱好

words.tran: 亲自地；当面；个别地；就自己而言
个性化（personalize的过去式）；个人化

trans.tranOther: belonging or relating to one particular person, rather than to other people or to people in general

trans.tranCn: 人事消息栏；人称代名词
